_meanings:
Done, performed,
made, effected, accomplished, 
manufactured &c.; ({%<ab>p. p.</ab>%} of {#kf#} {c8c} <ab>U.</ab> <ab>q. v.</ab>).

{@--6@} <ab>N.</ab> of the first
of the four Yugas of the world 
extending over 1728000 years of men;
(see <ls>Ms. 1. 69</ls> and <ls>Kull.</ls> thereon); but,
according to <ls>Mb.</ls>, over 4800 years
of men.

{@--9@} Prize or booty
gained in a battle.

done and not
done; {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} done in part but not
completed.

that
side of a die which is marked with
four points.

{2} fate, destiny; {#krUrastasminnapi na#}
{#sahate saMgamaM no kftAMtaH#} <ls>Me. 105.</ls>

{7} the 
inevitable result of former actions.

the die called {#kfta#} marked with four
points.

{1} having control
over oneself, self-possessed, of a
self-governed spirit.

one who has taken up his abode in
any place.

one who has 

performed his ablutions.

{2} practising penance by
standing with up-lifted hands.

{1} one who has done his work;  
<ls>R. 9. 3.</ls>

{1} one who has done
his work or obtained his object.

{2}
having no need of another's aid.

{1} fixed or settled as to
time.

{2} who has waited a certain
time.

{2} one who has got an 
opportunity.

a boy on whom
the ceremony of tonsure has been
performed; <ls>Ms. 5. 58</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 5.">67.</ls>

{1} one who has visited
or frequented holy places.

{2} one
who studies with a 
profesional teacher.

a
servant hired for a stated period, a
hired servant.

assault and counter-assault,
attack and resistance; <ls>R. 12. 94.</ls>

{1} one who has made
an agreement or engagement.

{2} one who has fulfilled
his promise.

<ab>Ved.</ab> one who
has performed his devotions.

the first (golden) of the
four ages.

a warrior
on the side of the Kauravas who
with Kṛpa and Aśvatthāman 
survived the general havoc of the great
Bhāratī war. He was afterwards
slain by Sātyaki.

a penitent
who has shaven his head and chin.

dislodged or dismissed from office, set aside;
<ls>Ku. 2. 27.</ls>

making an appointment;  
{#nAmasametaM kftasaMketaM vAdayate mfdu veRuM#} Git. 5

a woman whose husband has 
married another wife, a married woman
having a co-wife or a superseded
wife.
